00.Opcode Description: This bytecode is used for alignment of 1-byte opcodes and ending ElseIf blocks.

01.Opcode Description: This bytecode ends the current Main/Sub script.

02.Opcode Description: This bytecode moves to the next event in the sequence.

03.Opcode Description: This bytecode chains the current event to the specified next event ID, allowing the script to continue execution from the linked event.

Evt_no.Description: Event number (Numerical ID of SCD file)

04.Opcode Description: This bytecode executes the specified event with given parameters.

ScdId.Description: Sub Script ID to Jump to

05.Opcode Description: This bytecode terminates the specified event.

06.Opcode Description: This bytecode checks a condition and branches accordingly.

Size.Description: Size of the block to check

07.Opcode Description: This bytecode specifies the size of the block to check if the corresponding Ifel_ck condition is met.

Size.Description: Size of the block to check

08.Opcode Description: This bytecode marks the end of an If/ElseIf/Else block.

09.Opcode Description: This bytecode pauses script execution for the specified duration.

0A.Opcode Description: This bytecode pauses script execution for the specified duration.

0B.Opcode Description: This bytecode, used before 0C, waits until the current XA sound has finished playing before proceeding.

0C.Opcode Description: This bytecode, used after 0B, waits until the current XA sound has finished playing before proceeding.

0D.Opcode Description: This bytecode begins a for-loop with the specified start and end values.

Size.Description: Size of the block to check

Count.Description: Amount of times block is looped

0E.Opcode Description: This bytecode marks the end of a for-loop.

0F.Opcode Description: This bytecode begins a while-loop that continues as long as the specified condition is true.

Size.Description: Size of the block to check

10.Opcode Description: This bytecode ends the specified while-loop.

LoopId.Description: ID of the while-loop to end

11.Opcode Description: This bytecode begins a do-while loop that executes the loop body once before checking the condition.

Size.Description: Size of the block to check

12.Opcode Description: This bytecode ends the specified do-while loop.

LoopId.Description: ID of the do-while loop to end

13.Opcode Description: This bytecode begins a switch-case block with the specified switch variable and default size.

Size.Description: Size of the block to check

14.Opcode Description: This bytecode defines a case within a switch-case block.

Size.Description: Size of the block to check

CaseValue.Description: Value to compare with the switch variable

15.Opcode Description: This bytecode marks the default case in a switch-case block.

16.Opcode Description: This bytecode ends the switch-case block.

17.Opcode Description: This bytecode jumps to the specified offset within the script.

Offset.Description: Relative Pointer, always references the same script

18.Opcode Description: This bytecode calls the specified subroutine.

SubroutineId.Description: ID of the subroutine to call

19.Opcode Description: This bytecode returns from the specified subroutine.

1A.Opcode Description: This bytecode breaks out of the specified loop.

1B.Opcode Description: This bytecode begins a for-loop with the specified start and end values.

StartValue.Description: Start value of the loop counter

EndValue.Description: End value of the loop counter

1C.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets a breakpoint for debugging purposes.

1D.Opcode Description: This bytecode copies a value from the source index to the destination index with an optional typecast.

1E.Opcode Description: This bytecode is used for alignment of 1-byte opcodes and ending ElseIf blocks.

1F.Opcode Description: This bytecode is used for alignment of 1-byte opcodes and ending ElseIf blocks.

20.Opcode Description: This bytecode is used for alignment of 1-byte opcodes and ending ElseIf blocks.

21.Opcode Description: This bytecode checks the specified system flag and bit ID for the given On/Off state.

22.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified system flag and bit ID to the given On/Off state.

23.Opcode Description: This bytecode compares the specified system flag with the given value using the provided comparison operator.

MemberId.Description: ID of the member to compare

Value.Description: Value to compare the member to

24.Opcode Description: This bytecode saves the specified source value to the destination index.

25.Opcode Description: This bytecode copies the value from the source index to the destination index.

26.Opcode Description: This bytecode performs the specified arithmetic operation on the operands and stores the result.

Flag.Description: Memory Location to apply math to

27.Opcode Description: This bytecode performs the specified arithmetic operation on the two operands and stores the result.

Value.Description: Value to use in the operation

28.Opcode Description: This bytecode generates a random value.

29.Opcode Description: This bytecode changes the current camera to the specified camera ID.

2A.Opcode Description: This bytecode reverts to the previous camera.

2B.Opcode Description: This bytecode displays the specified message.

MessageId.Description: ID of the message to display

2C.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the properties of the specified AOT.

Data1.Description: Sce_Message / Flag Id / Script Id Init & Complete

2D.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the properties of the specified object model.

2E.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the properties of the specified work (task).

Type.Description: Type of Work Set to Select

2F.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified speed setting.

30.Opcode Description: This bytecode increments the speed setting.

31.Opcode Description: This bytecode increments the angular speed setting.

32.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the position in 3D space.

33.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the direction in 3D space.

34.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the properties of the specified member.

35.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets a single property of the specified member.

36.Opcode Description: This bytecode plays the specified sound effect with the given parameters.

37.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified scale ID to the given value.

38.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified floor ID to the given value.

39.Opcode Description: This bytecode checks the specified direction coordinates.

3A.Opcode Description: This bytecode turns on the specified espr with the given parameters.

3B.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified door AOT parameters.

3C.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified auto cutscene parameters.

3D.Opcode Description: This bytecode copies the specified member parameters from the source to the destination.

3E.Opcode Description: This bytecode compares the specified member parameters with the given value.

3F.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified motion parameters.

Mode.Description: Mode to set the motion to

40.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified destination parameters.

41.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified neck parameters.

42.Opcode Description: This bytecode returns from the specified plc function.

43.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified flag parameters.

44.Opcode Description: Spawn/set an enemy (EMD) with the specified parameters.

Em_no.Description: Enemy number / room slot (use 0xFF for partner)

EMD_Id.Description: EMD File Id for Em_bin_load() function; Enemy ID/type (last two characters of EMD filename)

45.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified color parameters.

46.Opcode Description: This bytecode resets the specified AOT parameters.

47.Opcode Description: This bytecode turns on the specified AOT.

48.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified super parameters.

49.Opcode Description: This bytecode resets the specified super parameters.

4A.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified gun parameters.

GunId.Description: ID of the gun to set

4B.Opcode Description: This bytecode replaces the specified cutscene parameters.

4C.Opcode Description: This bytecode kills the specified espr with the given parameters.

4D.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified door model parameters.

4E.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified item AOT parameters.

4F.Opcode Description: This bytecode checks the specified key parameters.

50.Opcode Description: This bytecode checks the specified trigger parameters.

51.Opcode Description: This bytecode controls the specified BGM parameters.

52.Opcode Description: This bytecode controls the specified espr parameters.

53.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified fade parameters.

54.Opcode Description: This bytecode turns on the specified 3D espr with the given parameters.

55.Opcode Description: This bytecode performs the specified arithmetic operation on the member with the given value.

56.Opcode Description: This bytecode performs the specified arithmetic operation on the member with the given value.

57.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified BGM table parameters.

58.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified rotation parameters.

59.Opcode Description: This bytecode turns on the specified XA with the given parameters.

5A.Opcode Description: This bytecode changes the specified weapon parameters.

WeaponId.Description: ID of the weapon to change

5B.Opcode Description: This bytecode performs the specified arithmetic operation on the counter with the given value.

5C.Opcode Description: This bytecode turns on the specified shake effect with the given parameters.

5D.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified water division parameters.

5E.Opcode Description: This bytecode checks the specified item parameters.

ItemId.Description: ID of the item to check

5F.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified XA volume and pan parameters.

60.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified shadow parameters.

61.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified cutscene parameters.

62.Opcode Description: This bytecode removes the specified item from the inventory.

63.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified gun effect parameters.

64.Opcode Description: This bytecode turns on the specified espr with the given parameters.

65.Opcode Description: This bytecode kills the specified espr with the given parameters.

EsprId.Description: ID of the effect sprite to kill

66.Opcode Description: This bytecode stops the specified plc function.

67.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified 4-point AOT parameters.

68.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified 4-point door AOT parameters.

69.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified 4-point item AOT parameters.

6A.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified light position parameters.

6B.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified light intensity and color parameters.

6C.Opcode Description: This bytecode resets the specified rbj parameters.

6D.Opcode Description: This bytecode moves the specified screen with the given parameters.

6E.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified parts parameters.

6F.Opcode Description: This bytecode plays the specified movie.

70.Opcode Description: This bytecode returns from the specified splc function.

71.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified splc parameters.

72.Opcode Description: This bytecode turns on the specified super with the given parameters.

73.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified mirror position parameters.

74.Opcode Description: This bytecode adjusts the specified fade parameters.

75.Opcode Description: This bytecode turns on the specified 3D espr with the given parameters.

76.Opcode Description: This bytecode gets the specified item with the given quantity.

77.Opcode Description: This bytecode starts the specified line with the given parameters.

78.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified line parameters.

79.Opcode Description: This bytecode ends the specified line.

7A.Opcode Description: This bytecode bombs the specified parts with the given parameters.

7B.Opcode Description: This bytecode moves down the specified parts with the given parameters.

7C.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified light color parameters.

7D.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified light position parameters.

7E.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified light intensity and color parameters.

7F.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified light color parameters.

80.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified sound effect volume and pan parameters.

81.Opcode Description: This bytecode checks the specified item parameters.

ItemId.Description: ID of the item to check

Quantity.Description: Quantity of the item to check

82.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified espr task parameters.

83.Opcode Description: This bytecode heals the specified plc function.

84.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified map hint parameters.

85.Opcode Description: This bytecode checks the specified enemy position parameters.

86.Opcode Description: This bytecode checks the specified poison parameters.

87.Opcode Description: This bytecode clears the specified poison parameters.

88.Opcode Description: This bytecode removes the specified item from the inventory.

89.Opcode Description: This bytecode moves to the next event in the sequence.

8A.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified vibration parameters.

8B.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified vibration parameters.

8C.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified vibration fade parameters.

8D.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified item AOT parameters.

MD1.Description: MD1 File Id - 0xFF if no MD1

8E.Opcode Description: This bytecode sets the specified enemy parameters.
